title: focus: Jana Gunstheimer
short_description: German artist Jana Gunstheimer (b. 1974) combines her academic training in ethnology with a refined figurative drawing practice to observe and comment on aspects of her own culture. Gunstheimer responds to the transformations she sees taking place in contemporary German society—including postindustrial desolation, drastic unemployment, and rising levels of aggression among people of her generation—by way of a semi-fictional organization she calls Nova Porta.
